page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT
page.content: A survey in School showed that 90% of fathers and 15% of working mothers worked away from the area. Several of the fathers, such as an architect and an electronics specialist, worked from home, visiting their offices only occasionally. Mothers working away included a doctor and a nurse. Local employers include farmers, three shops, two public houses, Westbury House nursing home (domestic work and nursing care), the doctor's surgery, the school and the garage. Private homes provide some domestic service, especially since there are several very large houses in the area. "Cottage" industries include a painter, a potter, a hairdresser and a lady who has a machine-knitting business.
